TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi StartupNextInstanceEventArgs extends System.EventArgs

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.ApplicationServices.WindowsFormsApplicationBase.StartupNextInstance> event occurs when a subsequent instance of a single-instance application starts, using the Visual Basic Application Model. For more information, see [Overview of the Visual Basic Application Model](../Topic/Overview%20of%20the%20Visual%20Basic%20Application%20Model.md).
StartupNextInstanceEventArgs contains the command-line arguments of the subsequent application instance and indicates whether the first application instance should be brought to the foreground upon exiting the exception handler.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection`1<string> args, bool bringToForegroundFlag) cil managed

Docs.param: A <xref:System.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection%601> object that contains the command-line arguments of the subsequent application instance.
A <see cref="T:System.Boolean"> that indicates whether the first application instance should be brought to the foreground upon exiting the exception handler.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the <see cref="T:Microsoft.VisualBasic.ApplicationServices.StartupNextInstanceEventArgs"> class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.ApplicationServices.WindowsFormsApplicationBase.StartupNextInstance> event occurs when a subsequent instance of a single-instance application starts, using the Visual Basic Application Model. For more information, see [Overview of the Visual Basic Application Model](../Topic/Overview%20of%20the%20Visual%20Basic%20Application%20Model.md).
<xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.ApplicationServices.StartupNextInstanceEventArgs> contains the command-line arguments of the subsequent application instance and indicates whether the first application instance should be brought to the foreground upon exiting the exception handler.

Docs.summary: Indicates whether the first application instance should be brought to the foreground upon exiting the exception handler.
Docs.value: A <see cref="T:System.Boolean"> that indicates whether the first application instance should be brought to the foreground upon exiting the exception handler.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The Visual Basic Application Model checks the value of this property after running the handlers of the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.ApplicationServices.WindowsFormsApplicationBase.StartupNextInstance> event. If the BringToForeground property is `True`, the first application instance is brought to the foreground. Otherwise, the first application instance remains where it was. For more information, see [Overview of the Visual Basic Application Model](../Topic/Overview%20of%20the%20Visual%20Basic%20Application%20Model.md).

Docs.summary: Gets the command-line arguments of the subsequent application instance.
Docs.value: A <xref:System.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection%601> object that contains the command-line arguments of the subsequent application instance.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.ApplicationServices.WindowsFormsApplicationBase.StartupNextInstance> event occurs when a subsequent instance of a single-instance application starts, using the Visual Basic Application Model. For more information, see [Overview of the Visual Basic Application Model](../Topic/Overview%20of%20the%20Visual%20Basic%20Application%20Model.md).
